intro: Taurostalix, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes evergreen shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink. Taurostalix is often found in rocky or forested areas where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
